author: Simon Rimmer
method: Preheat the oven to 180C/360F/Gas 4. Place the tomatoes, garlic and chilli flakes into a baking dish and drizzle over the olive oil. Roast in the oven for 25 minutes, or until the tomatoes are softened. Meanwhile in a bowl, mix together the breadcrumbs, pecorino cheese and thyme and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Spoon the mixture over the tomatoes and place back into the oven for 4-5 minutes, or until the top is golden-brown and crisp.  Spoon the tomato mixture over the penne pasta in a bowl and mix well. Spoon the penne into serving bowls, then garnish with the torn basil and serve with garlic bread.
ingredients: 350g/12oz cherry tomatoes,  3 cloves garlic, peeled, sliced,  1 tsp chilli flakes,  150ml/5½fl oz extra virgin olive oil,  125g/4½oz fresh breadcrumbs,  100g/3½oz finely grated pecorino cheese,  1 tsp chopped fresh thyme,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  450g/1lb freshly-cooked penne pasta,  1 tbsp torn fresh basil leaves,  garlic bread, to serve
